John’s wise words stuck with me, and I’ve passed his advice along as I mentor new Members here in the House. His wit and wisdom will be missed.
I’ll never forget what John said: You have an important job, but you’re not an important person. The minute you think you are is the minute you cut corners.
When I first came to Congress, John Dingell was one of the first people I sought out for advice.

Tawni and I are saddened to hear about the passing of former Rep. John Dingell.
John challenged all of us to come together to make life better for all Americans. His positive attitude will be missed.
Our prayers go to Debbie, the Dingell family and our Michigan neighbors tonight.

2/3 We don’t need a Republican or Democratic agenda – we need an American agenda. I was encouraged to hear bipartisan proposals in tonight’s #SOTU, including a commitment to lowering drug prices, rebuilding our failing infrastructure, and investing in cancer research.
1/3 We can all agree: America needs unity.

1/2 Another great Listening Session today in Tomah. I heard from folks in Monroe County about improvements to the VA that will help our local vets, responsible government spending, and the need for more bipartisanship so we can end the gridlock in DC.
If you didn’t get the chance to come to my La Crosse Listening Session, I’ll also be in Tomah and Viroqua later this week. Visit my website:  http://kind.house.gov  to learn more.
More great discussions about the spread of CWD, the threat of gun violence in our schools and churches, and rebuilding our failing river infrastructure.
2/2 Lowering healthcare and prescription drug costs, the need to protect Wisconsin’s outdoors, and the #ForThePeople Act, which will end partisan gerrymandering and take big money out of Washington.
1/2 Kicking off my Listening Tour today here in La Crosse. Great conversations so far about the issues that are impacting Wisconsinites, like:

We need to re-instill a sense of fiscal responsibility in Congress, which is why every year I find savings in my office budget and return our unused funds to the Treasury to pay down our National debt. Today, I am proud to announce that I’m returning $107,608.50. pic.twitter.com/mVgCFJ7973

Great to tour @WesternTC’s new Veteran Military Center here on campus before my La Crosse County Listening Session. A great resource and support for our servicemembers and vets attending Western Tech. pic.twitter.com/bYLKEMGf7v

I’m proud to introduce a bipartisan bill that will help pay down the national debt with unused Congressional office savings. It’s a drop in the bucket, but it's the fiscally responsible thing to do. https://kind.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-ron-kind-introduces-bipartisan-bill-help-pay-down-debt-congressional …

Very cool work being done, including:   New software to help understand medical procedure pricing, new technologies to monitor heart health - from your bed, board games that help kids cope with major surgeries, and apps that let you refill prescriptions just by taking a picture!
I’m here at the #InnovationShowcase at the Capitol, checking out the great work happening at the intersection of medical and digital innovation.
